com.xtructure.xevolution.genetics
Interface GenomeDecoder<D,T>

Type Parameters:
D - type of data used in Genome
T - phenotype of Genome
All Superinterfaces:
EvolutionObject
All Known Subinterfaces:
OneDGenomeDecoder<D>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractGenomeDecoder, ArithmeticGenomeDecoder, ArithmeticGenomeDecoder, DummyGenomeDecoder, NEATGenomeDecoder, OneDGenomeDecoderImpl
public interface GenomeDecoder<D,T>
extends EvolutionObject

The GenomeDecoder interface describes the method for decoding a Genome for simulation in the problem domain. Classes implementing this interface create instance of the phenotype represented by a given Genome's data.

Subclasses should extend AbstractEvolutionObject, unless users wish to provide their own logging object.

Author:
Luis Guimbarda

Method Summary
 T decode(Genome<D> genome)
          Creates an instance of the phenotype represented by the given Genome's data, which is appropriate for simulating in the problem domain.
